other_tests.findings: Thyrotropin level was highly elevated at 144.10 μU per milliliter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient had profound hypothyroidism due to not taking his prescribed thyroid hormone–replacement therapy. After reinitiating treatment, his thyrotropin level returned to normal after 4 months.

other_tests.findings: Persistently elevated creatine kinase levels, as well as aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
other_tests.changes_over_time: After stopping atorvastatin and reinitiating thyroid hormone therapy, the creatine kinase level remained elevated, indicating ongoing muscle inflammation.

other_tests.procedure_name: Follow-up appointment for repeat blood tests

other_tests.findings: Creatine kinase level remained elevated, indicating possible myopathy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After treatment compliance was ensured, there was marked improvement in fatigue and dyspnea within 1 month.
